intro: Sonneratia punctata, commonly known as the mangrove button or mangrove shrub, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is a small evergreen shrub that typically grows in brackish or saltwater environments, such as tidal mudflats and mangrove forests. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white in color. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms. Sonneratia punctata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
